required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The "One-piece" Autologous Tuberosity Graft : a Novel Concept in Ridge Preservation

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective study investigating clinically and radiologically the effectiveness of the use of a combined hard and soft tissue graft retrieved from the maxillary tuberosity and designed for alveolar ridge preservation following tooth extraction.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients scheduled for a single mono-rooted tooth extraction are included in the study. After atraumatic extraction, sockets are filled with a "one-piece" dual tissue graft harvested from the tuberosity using an adjusted trephine. CBCTs are performed before the extraction and 4 months after ridge preservation, to analyze the vertical and horizontal alterations of the ridge, using 'ITK-Snap' software.
Clinical measurements of both soft and hard tissues are also assessed during the extraction and implant placement.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of volume of the ridge from baseline to 4 months post-op
primary_outcome.description: Volumetric variation of the ridge, measured on superimposed images of CBCT.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Vertical dimension of the ridge from baseline to 4 months post-op
primary_outcome.description: Linear Vertical variation of the ridge, measured on superimposed images of CBCT.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Horizontal dimension of the ridge from baseline to 4 months post-op
primary_outcome.description: Linear Horizontal variation of the ridge at 3 different levels, measured on superimposed images of CBCT.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Soft tissue from baseline to 4 months post-op
primary_outcome.description: Variation of the thickness of the buccal keratinized mucosa at 2 different levels, measured on superimposed images of CBCT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in buccal Soft tissue from baseline to 4 months post-op (clinical measurements)
secondary_outcome.description: Thickness of the keratinized mucosa on the buccal site, measured with a gauge caliper.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in crestal Soft tissue from baseline to 4 months post-op (clinical measurements)
secondary_outcome.description: Thickness of the keratinized mucosa on the crestal site, measured with a gauge caliper.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Hard tissue from baseline to 4 months post-op (clinical measurements)
secondary_outcome.description: Horizontal dimension of the ridge (bucco-lingual) measured with a periodontal probe

arm_group.description: Extraction sockets filled with a "one-piece" dual tissue graft harvested from the tuberosity using an adjusted trephine.

intervention.description: 'One-Piece' autologous tuberosity graft combining hard and soft tissue, harvested from the maxillary tuberosity, placed in extraction sockets.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy patient
- Patient with at least one single-rooted tooth to be extracted and be replaced with an implant
- No signs of acute infection : edema, suppuration, abscess, spontaneous bleeding
- Non-smoker or Light Smoker < 10 cigarettes/day
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or lactating females
- Non-controlled periodontal disease
- Medical conditions that contraindicate implant surgery
- Metabolic bone disorders such as osteoporosis,..
- Severe psychiatric conditions
- Heavy smoker > 10 cigarettes/day
